data.title: cannot copy from watch view

data.body:
- have a watch expression

you cannot select to copy the value of the watch expression

data.title: The unsaved file marker (the dot thing) should appear when content in buffer != content on disk
data.body:
Testing #1854

I have configured `"files.autoSaveDelay": 10000` (10s). If I make an edit to a file I expect to see the unsaved file marker for 10s and then, after the file is saved, it disappears. Right now, I never see the dirty marker, even if I use a very large number for `"files.autoSaveDelay"` such as 1 week, effectively disabling the auto-save behaviour.

data.title: Virtual documents: allow the document to be colored with a mode
data.body: I think it would be cool to have a way for a virtual document to be colored by one of the language modes installed so that you can e.g. show code snippets for a language and leverage the same coloring we already have for files.

data.title: Implement focus indication for editors

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Testing #2145

cc @stevencl @bgashler1 

Here I am tabbing into the editor from the find widget. There is no visual indication that the editor just got the focus.

![no-focus-code-editor](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5047891/12582696/f4a66c2c-c43e-11e5-897c-fc58da80f1b5.gif)

@bpasero Feel free to give to me if you think I should do something inside the editor or otherwise keep it if you think the workbench should highlight somehow the title area to indicate focus.

data.title: Virtual documents: Allow me to provide a description label for the editor
data.body:
It would be nice to have more control over the description label for a virtual document. Today since we just communicate via custom URIs, the path segment will be used as description, which in most cases is probably not what I want. 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/12582664/be7f7080-c43e-11e5-8066-cdb46e181a4e.png)

data.title: Debug console doesn't show stderr output
data.body:
- follow steps in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/2231
- debug the program

You see:

data.title: <input>s and <select>s should have the same focus style
data.body:
Testing #2145
- a `<select>` gets a blue focus border:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5047891/12582469/a1f0d004-c43d-11e5-919e-8f3a38a45b59.png)
- while a `<input>` does not

We should see what is best and be consistent, either both get a focus border or not.

data.title: MonacoLocalization npm install should install all the dependencies (lib ones)
Focus moves to <body> in this case
data.body:
Testing #2145
- search for something
- have some results
- tab to the first result file
- tab to the 'X'
- press arrow down
  > focus goes to `<body>` according to `activeElement`

expected: focus stays in the tree or somewhere.

data.title: Sorting snippets along with regular proposals leads to an unhappy user experience

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6461412/12582173/bd034aea-c43b-11e5-840c-33dbcc34930b.png)

In 0.10.1 we sorted snippets at end. Until we have better mechanisms to know at what locations a snippet makes sense, we should not present them along with the other proposals

FYI @egamma

data.title: OutputChannel#show doc comment broken
data.body: The comment changes at https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/vscode.d.ts#L2472 break the jsdoc comment.

data.title: The focused element should always be visible
data.body:
Testing #2145

In this case, I have resized the viewlet area in such a way that the `Start (F5)` button is pushed out of the viewport. The button should not be focusable if it is not visible, alternatively the viewlet area should have a different min-width when the debug viewlet is open or the debug viewlet should get a horiz. scrollbar.

Steps: Shift-tab a lot => you will no longer see the active element once you reach the `Start (F5)` button.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5047891/12581973/5e542ef2-c43a-11e5-8ebd-5a918fe37ed8.png)

data.title: one tiny change - "Go To Definition in on Side"
data.body: in a code screen, the right click on a method / function gives the user the "Go To Definition". It would be super productive if below that was "Go To Definition in on Side", so that i can control if it opens on the side.

data.title: Rendering of documentation in Intellisense and hover inconsistent
data.body:
Testing #2230 

The rendering of the documentation in the hover and in Intellisense is inconsistent, different font, font size, font family, and color.
Suggest to align on the way the documentation is rendered in Intellisense. It looks nicer.

![hover](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/172399/12581794/365ad5dc-c439-11e5-8a96-28296bcabdc4.png)

![intellisense](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/172399/12581796/37c7bc96-c439-11e5-8535-1c30c78f22a9.png)

FYI @bgashler1 
## 
- [x] Delayed hover
- [x] Diagnostics hover
- [x] Glyph hover
  - [x] Debug breakpoint expressions colorisation
- [x] URL click hover
- [x] Suggest widget
- [ ] Parameter hints widget

data.title: Hiding actions using display:none causes keyboard a11y issues
data.body:
Testing #2145

In the working files:
- tab until the last action
- tab takes you to the file
- tab takes you to the close file action <--- missed by shift-tab
- tab takes you to the file/folder explorer
  > Shift-tab should take you back to the close file action, instead it jumps straight to the file
